action.action-desc: Mrs. Ellmers of North Carolina (for herself, Mr. Whitfield, Mr. Hurt of Virginia, Mr. Gibbs, Mr. LaMalfa, Mr. Rouzer, Mr. Tipton, and Mr. Jones) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for the determination of the employer mandate under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act without regard to alien agricultural seasonal workers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fairness for Farmers Act of 2015.

section.header: Determination of employer mandate without regard to alien agricultural seasonal workers

subsection.text: Section 4980H(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Exception for certain alien agricultural seasonal workers
subparagraph.text: In the case of any alien having status under section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a))â€”

clause.text: the term full-time employee shall not include such individual, and
such individual shall not be taken into account under paragraph (2)(E).

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to months beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
